name: Yacht Rock

name: 20th Century
description_short: Where the romantic period ends and the modern era begins – merging Modernism, Impressionism, Expressionism and atonality.

name: 21st Century
description_short: Featuring works composed after the millennium – modern and eclectic whilst keeping traditional styles of the old masters.

name: Bach
description_short: Johann Sebastian Bach (1685-1750) was a German composer of the Baroque period revered for his technical command, artistic beauty and intellectual depth.

name: Ballets
description_short: Intricate and emotional dance music from the courts of the 17th century to modern day. Features music from the most famous ballets, past and present.

name: Baroque Period
description_short: Listen to delightful classical music from the Baroque Period (1600-1750), an era of ornate beauty, dramatic contrasts, and animated intensity.

name: Beethoven
description_short: Ludwig van Beethoven (1770-1827) was a German composer and pianist who was a crucial figure in the transition between the Classical and Romantic eras.

name: Brahms
description_short: Johannes Brahms (1833-1897) was a German composer and pianist who composed for piano, chamber ensembles, orchestra, voice and chorus.

name: Cello Works
description_short: Enjoy everything from solo performances to full concertos with the Cello front and center – works that celebrate the instrument’s ability to convey intimacy, drama, and beauty.

name: Chamber Works
description_short: Chamber music is performed as collaboration between a small number of performers creating an intimate and friendly atmosphere.

name: Chopin
description_short: Frédéric Chopin (1810-1849) was a Polish composer and virtuoso pianist of the Romantic era who wrote primarily for the solo piano.

name: Choral Works
description_short: Specifically written for and performed by large choirs; featuring music from Bach, Mendelssohn, Mozart, Handel, Brahms and many more.

name: Classical Period
description_short: Enjoy marvelous musical compositions from masters of the Classical Period (1730-1820) – Mozart, Haydn, Boccherini, and many more.

name: Classical Piano Trios
description_short: Classical piano trio is one of the most common forms of classical chamber music featuring the piano and often accompanied by violin and cello.

name: Classical Relaxation
description_short: Let the mind and soul relax and unwind to classical music from all eras – tender compositions and peaceful harmonies will ease your day.

name: Concertos
description_short: Be enraptured by the intricate interplay between solo instruments and the full-sized orchestra, featuring Piano, Violin, Cello, Trumpet concertos and more.

name: Contemporary Period
description_short: This post modernistic era started in earnest after 1945 and focused on exploring experimental forms such as eclecticism, serialism and new ways of instrumentation.

name: Handel
description_short: George Frideric Handel (1685-1759) was a German born British Baroque composer well known for his oratorios such as ‘Messiah’ as well as numerous operas, anthems and organ concertos.

name: Harpsichord Works
description_short: Experience the characteristic sounds of the Harpsichord; precursor to the modern piano. The harpsichord was widely used in Renaissance and Baroque music.

name: Haydn
description_short: Joseph Haydn (1732-1809) was an Austrian composer whose contributions have earned him the epithets "Father of the Symphony" and "Father of the String Quartet".

name: Medieval Period
description_short: Commonly considered to be between 500-1400 AD and includes musical art forms such as Gregorian chants, motets, madrigals and canons to name a few.

name: Mozart
description_short: Enjoy the wonderful works of the magnificent Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (1756-1791) – one of history’s most celebrated and popular composers.

name: Operas
description_short: Enjoy complete performances of world-famous operas by Verdi, Puccini, Mozart and many more, performed by the greatest artists of the opera world.

name: Orchestral Works
description_short: Works heard in Symphonies, Concertos, Ballet music and more, performed by some of the most accomplished orchestras of our time.

name: Organ Works
description_short: Classical music written for and performed on the grandest musical instrument in size and scope, or as Mozart put it; “The King of instruments”.

name: Overtures
description_short: Originally introductions to Opera; overtures evolved through composers such as Beethoven and Mendelssohn as independent, self-existing instrumentals.

name: Piano Works
description_short: The predominant keyboard instrument since the early 19th century; many of history’s most beloved classical works were written for the piano.

name: Easy Classical
description_short: Captivating and delightful classical music from the most popular eras and the most beloved composers.

name: Renaissance Period
description_short: Freed from the constraints of the Medieval Period, music in the 15th century started to expand in range, rhythm, harmony, form, and notation.

name: Romantic Period
description_short: Enjoy expressive and emotional classical music from the Romantic Period (1780-1910) – unforgettable works by Tchaikovsky, Brahms, Chopin, and many more.

name: Sacred Works
description_short: Experience divine music written for performance during religious services or on solemn occasions – most heard through masses, cantatas and oratorios.

name: Solo Instruments
description_short: Delightful masterpieces written specifically for solo instruments including piano, violin, cello, oboe, clarinet, and others.

name: Solo Piano
description_short: Musical journeys with piano masters and talented undiscovered pianists – featuring beloved works by Beethoven, Debussy, Chopin, and many more.

name: Sonatas
description_short: Evolving from the Baroque period, Sonatas are an instrumental musical composition typically of three or four movements in contrasting forms and keys.

name: Songs & Lieder
description_short: Inspired by the flowering of German literature and poetry of the 19th century this musical art form was championed by the likes of Schubert, Schumann, Brahms, Mahler and more.

name: String Works
description_short: A dedication to music written for stringed instruments such as Violin, Cello, Viola, etc.; performed solo, in groups or together with an orchestra.

name: Symphonies
description_short: Extended musical compositions, often written for orchestra, consisting of multiple, distinct sections or movements. This channel invites you to experience music on a grand scale.

name: Tchaikovsky
description_short: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky (1840-1893), the Romantic era composer who created some of the most popular concert and theatrical music in the classical repertoire.

name: Violin Works
description_short: Enjoy everything from solo performances to full concertos with the violin front and center – featuring works by Vivaldi, Brahms, Paganini, and more.

name: Vivaldi
description_short: Antonio Vivaldi (1678-1741) – an Italian virtuoso violinist and recognized as one of the greatest Baroque composers whose influence during his lifetime was widespread across Europe.

name: Wind Works
description_short: Charming classical music written for flutes, clarinets, bassoons, trumpets etc. Performed solo, in groups or together with an orchestra.

name: Classical Guitar Works
description_short: Explore the cool, passionate and articulate sounds of the guitar throughout the ages.

name: Gregorian Chant
description_short: Monophonic, unaccompanied and sacred, Gregorian chant developed mainly in western and central Europe during the 9th and 10th centuries with a popular resurgence in the 20th century.

name: Flute Works
description_short: Experience the rich and tranquil sounds of the flute; one of our oldest and most intriguing instruments.

name: Opera Highlights
description_short: This channel features the best pieces from the world’s most wonderful operas performed by legendary contemporary vocalists and musicians.

name: Schubert
description_short: Austrian composer Franz Peter Schubert (1797-1828) was ranked among the greatest composers of his era. He wrote over 600 secular works, symphonies, operas, and a large amount of chamber and piano music.

name: Classical Christmas
description_short: Your favorite classical Christmas music for the holiday season – this is emotive and elegant music that captures the magic of the season.

name: Adagios
description_short: Calming and comforting, the sound of an Adagio is gentle, slow and stunning. A relaxing sound of classic beauty which is ideal for mental focus, and to simply ease the mind after a busy day.

name: Grieg
description_short: Edvard Hagerup Grieg (1843–1907); considered one of the leading Romantic composers, Grieg was a skilled pianist influenced by Norwegian folk music and folk culture throughout his career.

name: Shostakovich
description_short: Dmitri D. Shostakovich (1906-1975); one of the major composers of the 20th Century. A polystylist whose symphonies and quartets are among the most prominent from that era.

name: Trumpet Works
description_short: The trumpet is one of the strongest of all the orchestral instruments. Not only can it be heard over the rest of the orchestra; it’s also the most agile of brass instruments.

name: Waltzes, Polkas & Marches
description_short: The big dance craze of the 19th Century – featuring uplifting works by composers such as Chopin, Waldteufel, and of course the Strauss family.

name: Debussy
description_short: Claude Debussy (1862-1918) is considered one of the most influential composers of the late 19th and 20th centuries, and also sometimes described as the first Impressionist composer.

name: Nocturnes
description_short: Gentle pieces of classical music – dreamy and relaxing compositions that are inspired by, or evocative of, the night.

name: Liszt
description_short: Franz Liszt (1811-1886) – a Hungarian piano virtuoso and composer of the Romantic era. He was a very prolific composer and one of the most famous concert superstars of the 19th century.

name: Telemann
description_short: Georg Philipp Telemann (1681-1767) – a revered German Baroque composer and one of the most prolific composers. His music represents a link between the late Baroque and the early Classical styles.

name: Relaxing Flute
description_short: An ambiance of complete relaxation and serenity – these calm flute works are perfect for winding down, studying, working, or meditation.

name: Relaxing Piano
description_short: Relaxing piano sounds with rich compositions and calming melodies – just tune in, wind down, and recharge.

name: ICONYC Radio
description_short: ICONYC Radio, is the brand new channel exclusively on the global platform DI.FM. Showcasing forward-thinking Melodic House, Techno, Dark Disco, and Afro. Curated by the artistic team behind the renowned label, ICONYC Radio delivers a finely tuned selection of crafted music by leading innovators, musical tastemakers, and genre-defying artists.
